crisisEvents.name: Sea Peoples Invasions
crisisEvents.description: Massive migrations and attacks by Sea Peoples confederation

crisisEvents.name: Fall of Nineveh
crisisEvents.description: Coalition of Babylonians, Medes, and Scythians destroyed the empire

crisisEvents.name: Bronze Age Collapse
crisisEvents.description: Collapse during Bronze Age crisis, Sea Peoples involvement

crisisEvents.name: Crisis of the Third Century
crisisEvents.description: Military anarchy, civil wars, barbarian invasions, economic collapse

crisisEvents.name: Fourth Crusade
crisisEvents.description: Crusaders sacked Constantinople, fragmenting the empire

crisisEvents.name: Fall of Constantinople
crisisEvents.description: Ottoman conquest ended the Byzantine Empire

crisisEvents.name: Third Punic War
crisisEvents.description: Rome destroyed Carthage, ending the Punic civilization

crisisEvents.name: Arab Conquest
crisisEvents.description: Muslim Arab conquest ended the Sasanian Empire

crisisEvents.name: An Lushan Rebellion
crisisEvents.description: Massive rebellion that killed millions and weakened Tang power

crisisEvents.name: Jin Conquest of Northern China
crisisEvents.description: Jurchen Jin dynasty conquered northern China, forcing Song south

crisisEvents.name: Mongol Conquest
crisisEvents.description: Mongol conquest ended the Song dynasty

crisisEvents.name: Taiping Rebellion
crisisEvents.description: Deadliest civil war in history, killed 20-30 million people

crisisEvents.name: Opium Wars
crisisEvents.description: British and French forced China to open to Western trade

crisisEvents.name: Moroccan Invasion
crisisEvents.description: Moroccan army with firearms destroyed the Songhai Empire

crisisEvents.name: Classic Maya Collapse
crisisEvents.description: Major cities abandoned, civilization declined in southern lowlands

crisisEvents.name: Spanish Conquest
crisisEvents.description: Spanish conquistadors destroyed the Aztec Empire

crisisEvents.name: Inca Civil War
crisisEvents.description: War of succession between Huascar and Atahualpa

crisisEvents.name: Spanish Conquest
crisisEvents.description: Spanish conquistadors destroyed the Inca Empire

crisisEvents.name: Thirty Years War
crisisEvents.description: Religious conflict devastated Central Europe

crisisEvents.name: Mongol Siege of Baghdad
crisisEvents.description: Mongols destroyed Baghdad, killed the Caliph, ended the Caliphate

crisisEvents.name: Siege of Vienna (1683)
crisisEvents.description: Failed siege marked the end of Ottoman expansion in Europe

crisisEvents.name: World War I
crisisEvents.description: Defeat in WWI led to empire's dissolution
